From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To identify the type of device sending Maintenance Operation Protocol (MOP) System Identification (sysid) messages and request program messages, use the **mopÂ device-code**command in global configuration mode. To set the identity to the default value, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: Denotes a Cisco device code. This is the default.

Examples: The following example identifies a DECserver 200 device as sending MOP sysid and request program messages:
ExtraInfo: The sysid messages and request program messages use the identity information indicated by this command.

RelatedCmds.description: Enables an interface to send out periodic MOP system identification messages.
